dt: {bc}to push or shove up from below
{bc}to promote the cause or interests of {bc}{sx|plug||}

dt.t: a campaign to {wi}boost{/wi} the new fashions

dt: {bc}to raise the voltage of or across (an electric circuit)

dt.t: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) recently authorized the practice of {wi}boosting{/wi} people with a shot that's different from their primary series.

Mr. Biden … pleaded with Americans to get vaccinated or {wi}boosted{/wi} with an extra dose if they haven't already, saying the shots appeared to stave off deaths from the previous worrisome mutation, the delta variant.

pt: {sc}lift{/sc} {sc}raise{/sc} {sc}rear{/sc} {sc}elevate{/sc} {sc}hoist{/sc} {sc}heave{/sc} {sc}boost{/sc} mean to move from a lower to a higher place or position. {sc}lift{/sc} usually implies exerting effort to overcome resistance of weight.
{sc}raise{/sc} carries a stronger implication of bringing up to the vertical or to a high position.
{sc}rear{/sc} may add an element of suddenness to {sc}raise{/sc}.

pt.t: suddenly {it}reared{/it} itself up on its hind legs

pt: {sc}elevate{/sc} may replace {sc}lift{/sc} or {sc}raise{/sc} especially when exalting or enhancing is implied.
{sc}hoist{/sc} implies lifting something heavy especially by mechanical means.
{sc}heave{/sc} implies lifting and throwing with great effort or strain.
{sc}boost{/sc} suggests assisting to climb or advance by a push.

shortdef: to push or shove up from below
to promote the cause or interests of : plug
